attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash
set -ex

#Install Basic plugins
sudo yum -y install unzip
sudo curl -o batch-install-jenkins-plugins.sh https://gist.githubusercontent.com/micw/e80d739c6099078ce0f3/raw/33a21226b9938382c1a6aa68bc71105a774b374b/install_jenkins_plugin.sh
sudo chmod +x batch-install-jenkins-plugins.sh
echo 'credentials-binding
bouncycastle-api
windows-slaves
ssh-credentials 
ssh-slaves
credentials
plain-credentials
credentials-binding
authentication-tokens
nutanix-calm
docker-plugin
kubernetes
kubernetes-cd
pam-auth
script-security
cloudbees-folder
cloudbees-credentials
gitea
workflow-aggregator' | sudo tee plugins

git config --global http.sslVerify false
sudo systemctl stop jenkins
sudo mkdir -p /var/lib/jenkins/plugins
#sudo ./batch-install-jenkins-plugins.sh -p plugins -d /var/lib/jenkins/plugins
sudo ./batch-install-jenkins-plugins.sh $(echo $(cat plugins))
sudo systemctl start jenkins 
sleep 60

#!/bin/bash

echo "authpwd="$(sudo cat /var/lib/jenkins/secrets/initialAdminPassword)

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# Create the CA cert file from the variable, move into proper folder, update permissions and trust
echo -n '@@{Gitea.GITEA_CA}@@' | base64 --decode >> gitca.crt
sudo mv gitca.crt /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/.
sudo chown root:root /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/gitca.crt
sudo chmod 644 /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/gitca.crt
sudo update-ca-trust

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

#Download jenkins-cli
sudo yum -y install wget
sudo wget http://@@{Jenkins_Master.address}@@:8080/jnlpJars/jenkins-cli.jar
git config --global http.sslVerify false

#!/bin/bash


JENKINS_URL=http://@@{Jenkins_Master.address}@@:8080
NODE_NAME=@@{address}@@
NODE_SLAVE_HOME='/home/centos'
EXECUTORS=1
SSH_PORT=22
CRED_ID=Jenkins_Slave
LABELS='build docker'
USERID=admin

echo "Creating credential"

#Create credential
echo '<com.cloudbees.jenkins.plugins.sshcredentials.impl.BasicSSHUserPrivateKey plugin="ssh-credentials@1.13">
  <scope>GLOBAL</scope>
  <id>Jenkins_Slave</id>
  <description></description>
  <username>@@{CENTOS.username}@@</username>
  <privateKeySource class="com.cloudbees.jenkins.plugins.sshcredentials.impl.BasicSSHUserPrivateKey$DirectEntryPrivateKeySource">
    <privateKey>
    @@{CENTOS.secret}@@
    </privateKey>
  </privateKeySource>
</com.cloudbees.jenkins.plugins.sshcredentials.impl.BasicSSHUserPrivateKey>' | sudo java -jar jenkins-cli.jar -s "${JENKINS_URL}"  -http -auth ${USERID}:@@{Jenkins_Master.authpwd}@@ create-credentials-by-xml system::system::jenkins _

echo "Creating slave node"

#Create Slave Node
cat <<EOF | sudo java -jar jenkins-cli.jar -s "${JENKINS_URL}" -http -auth ${USERID}:@@{Jenkins_Master.authpwd}@@ create-node ${NODE_NAME}
<slave>
  <name>${NODE_NAME}</name>
  <description></description>
  <remoteFS>${NODE_SLAVE_HOME}</remoteFS>
  <numExecutors>${EXECUTORS}</numExecutors>
  <mode>NORMAL</mode>
  <retentionStrategy class="hudson.slaves.RetentionStrategy$Always"/>
  <launcher class="hudson.plugins.sshslaves.SSHLauncher" plugin="ssh-slaves@1.21">
    <host>${NODE_NAME}</host>
    <port>${SSH_PORT}</port>
    <credentialsId>${CRED_ID}</credentialsId>
    <maxNumRetries>0</maxNumRetries>
    <retryWaitTime>0</retryWaitTime>
    <sshHostKeyVerificationStrategy class="hudson.plugins.sshslaves.verifiers.NonVerifyingKeyVerificationStrategy"/>
  </launcher>
  <label>${LABELS}</label>
  <nodeProperties/>
</slave>
EOF

attrs.script:
# Set the jwt, headers and payload
jwt = '@@{calm_jwt}@@'
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json',
           'Authorization': 'Bearer {}'.format(jwt)}
payload = {}

# Set the address and make images call to get our cookie
url = "https://localhost:9440/api/nutanix/v3/images/list"
resp = urlreq(url, verb='POST', params=json.dumps(payload), headers=headers, verify=False)

# If the images call went through successfully, extract the cookie and make acs/list
if resp.ok:

  # Set the new headers and cookies, and print cookies for next task
  headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}
  cookies = {'NTNX_IGW_SESSION': resp.cookies['NTNX_IGW_SESSION']}
  print "COOKIES={0}".format(resp.cookies['NTNX_IGW_SESSION'])
  
  # Set the new url and make the call
  url = "https://localhost:7050/acs/k8s/cluster/list"
  resp = urlreq(url, verb='POST', cookies=cookies,
                params=json.dumps(payload), headers=headers, verify=False)
  
  # If the acs/list call went through successfully, print the ip and uuid of the cluster
  if resp.ok:
    for cluster in json.loads(resp.content):
      if cluster['cluster_metadata']['name'] == "@@{karbon_cluster_name}@@":
        print "K8S_UUID={0}".format(cluster['cluster_metadata']['uuid'])
        print "K8S_IP={0}".format(cluster['cluster_metadata']['k8s_config']['master_config']['external_ip'])
        exit(0)
    # If we got to this point, we didn't find a matching cluster name
    print "ERRROR: A Karbon Kubernetes cluster name of '@@{karbon_cluster_name}@@' was not found."
    print json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
    exit(1)
    
  # If the acs/list call failed
  else:
    print "Cluster create failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
    exit(1)

# If the call failed
else:
  print "Images call failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
  exit(1)

# If we made it this far, there was an error
print "Unknown Error"
exit(1)

# Set the headers, payload, and cookies
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}
cookies = {'NTNX_IGW_SESSION': '@@{COOKIES}@@'}

# Set the address and make kubeconfig call
url = "https://localhost:7050/acs/k8s/cluster/@@{K8S_UUID}@@/kubeconfig"
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', cookies=cookies, headers=headers, verify=False)

# If the call went through successfully, print out the kubeconfig
if resp.ok:
  print "KUBECONFIG={0}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['yml_config'])
  exit(0)

# If the call failed
else:
  print "Get kubeconfig failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
  exit(1)

# Set the headers, payload, and cookies
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}
cookies = {'NTNX_IGW_SESSION': '@@{NEW_COOKIES}@@'}

# Set the address and make kubeconfig call
url = "https://localhost:7050/acs/k8s/cluster/@@{K8S_UUID}@@/kubeconfig"
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', cookies=cookies, headers=headers, verify=False)

# If the call went through successfully, print out the kubeconfig
if resp.ok:
  print "NEW_KUBECONFIG={0}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['yml_config'])
  exit(0)

# If the call failed
else:
  print "Get kubeconfig failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
  exit(1)

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# Create kubeconfig
echo '@@{Kubernetes.NEW_KUBECONFIG}@@' | base64 --decode > ~/.kube/config

# Validate kubeconfig
kubectl version
kubectl get nodes

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

sudo yum -y update
sudo yum -y install vim jq git wget

echo "alias k=kubectl" | tee -a ~/.bash_profile
echo "export GIT_REPO_URL=https://@@{Gitea.address}@@:3000/gitadmin/hello-kubernetes" | tee -a ~/.bash_profile
echo "export JENKINS_HOOK_URL=http://@@{Jenkins_Master.address}@@:8080/gitea-webhook/post" | tee -a ~/.bash_profile

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# Install kubectl
curl -LO https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-release/release/`curl -s https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-release/release/stable.txt`/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl
chmod +x ./kubectl
sudo mv ./kubectl /usr/local/bin/kubectl

# Create kubeconfig
mkdir ~/.kube
echo '@@{Kubernetes.KUBECONFIG}@@' | base64 --decode > ~/.kube/config

# Validate kubeconfig
kubectl version
kubectl get nodes

# Install MetalLB
kubectl apply -f https://raw.githubusercontent.com/google/metallb/v0.8.3/manifests/metallb.yaml

# Install nmap
sudo yum -y install nmap

# Get subnet

network=$(/usr/sbin/ip route | awk '{print $1}' | grep 10.*)

# Get unused ips

ip_list=($(nmap -v -sn -n $network -oG - | awk '/Status: Down/{print $2}'))


# Convert IP to decimal
iptodec=($(for i in "${ip_list[@]}"; do echo ${i} |tr . '\n' | awk '{s = s*256 + $1} END{print s}'; done))

# Sort the result
sorted=($(printf '%s\n' "${iptodec[@]}"|sort))

# Get the length of the array of IPs for loop iteration

len=${#sorted[@]}

# Loop through the elments in sorted variable and check if two numbers are consecutive

for ((check=1;check<$len;check++))
do
    first=${sorted[$check]}
    second=${sorted[$check+1]}
    first_increment=$[first+1]
    if [[ $second = $first_increment ]]; then
      echo "enterd if condtion"
      MLBIP1=$(export ip=$first; for i in {1..4}; do s='.'$((ip%256))$s && ((ip>>=8)); done; echo ${s:1})
      MLBIP2=$(export ip=$second; for i in {1..4}; do s='.'$((ip%256))$s && ((ip>>=8)); done; echo ${s:1})
      break
    else
      continue
    fi
done
# Create MetalLB config map

cat << EOF > metallb-config.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  namespace: metallb-system
  name: config
data:
  config: |
    address-pools:
    - name: default
      protocol: layer2
      addresses:
      - $MLBIP1-$MLBIP2
EOF

# Apply MetalLB config map
kubectl apply -f metallb-config.yaml

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# Set up keys/fingerprints on workstation
echo "@@{CENTOS.secret}@@" > ~/.ssh/id_rsa
echo "@@{CENTOS.public_key}@@" > ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub
chmod 600 ~/.ssh/id_rsa*
ssh-keyscan @@{Gitea.address}@@ >> gitkey
ssh-keygen -lf gitkey
echo `cat gitkey` >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts

# Set up password file
echo "machine @@{Gitea.address}@@
login gitadmin
password @@{gitea_password}@@" > ~/.netrc

# Configure basic git settings
git config --global push.default simple
git config --global user.email "noreply@nutanix.com"
git config --global user.name "workstation"
git config --global http.sslVerify false

# Clone the internal repo
git clone https://@@{Gitea.address}@@:3000/gitadmin/hello-kubernetes.git
cd hello-kubernetes/

# Make first commit to ensure things are working properly
sed -i 's/world/Nutanix/g' server.js
git add server.js
git commit -m 'first commit, updated banner message'
git push -u origin master
git log -p -1

#!/bin/bash

# -*- Install Mysql
sudo yum update -y --quiet
sudo yum install -y  htop wget curl iotop xfs* bc unzip lvm2* git vim jq python3
sudo pip3 install -U simplejson

sudo sed -i 's/^SELINUX=.*/SELINUX=disabled/' /etc/sysconfig/selinux
sudo sed -i 's/^SELINUX=.*/SELINUX=disabled/' /etc/selinux/config
sudo setenforce 0

echo "System packages are installed"

#!/bin/bash

##############
#
# LVM setup script for MySQL . 4 disks for DATA and 4 for logs
# Data disks are 50GB | Log disks are 25GB 
#
#############


#PGSQL data
sudo pvcreate /dev/sdb /dev/sdc /dev/sdd /dev/sde
sudo vgcreate mysqlDataVG /dev/sdb /dev/sdd /dev/sdc /dev/sde
sudo lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i4 -I1M -n mysqlDataLV mysqlDataVG          ## Use 1MB to avoid IO amplification 
#lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i4 -I4M -n pgDataLV pgDataVG


#PGSQL logs
sudo pvcreate /dev/sdf /dev/sdg /dev/sdh /dev/sdi
sudo vgcreate mysqlLogVG /dev/sdf /dev/sdg /dev/sdh /dev/sdi
sudo lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i2 -I1M -n mysqlLogLV mysqlLogVG            ## Use 1MB to avoid IO amplification
#lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i2 -I4M -n pgLogLV pgLogVG


#Disable LVM read ahead
sudo lvchange -r 0 /dev/mysqlDataVG/mysqlDataLV
sudo lvchange -r 0 /dev/mysqlLogVG/mysqlLogLV


#Format LVMs with ext4 and use nodiscard to make sure format time is fast on Nutanix due to SCSI unmap
sudo mkfs.ext4 -E nodiscard /dev/mysqlDataVG/mysqlDataLV
sudo mkfs.ext4 -E nodiscard /dev/mysqlLogVG/mysqlLogLV

sleep 30

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

sudo hostnamectl set-hostname "@@{name}@@"

# -*- Mysql installation 
sudo yum install -y --quiet "http://repo.mysql.com/mysql80-community-release-el7.rpm"
sudo yum update -y --quiet
sudo yum install -y --quiet sshpass mysql-community-server.x86_64

#!/bin/bash


echo "!includedir /etc/my.cnf.d" | sudo tee -a /etc/my.cnf

echo "[mysqld]
binlog-format=mixed
log-bin=mysql-bin
datadir=/mysql/data
sql_mode=NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION,STRICT_TRANS_TABLES
innodb_data_home_dir = /mysql/data
innodb_log_group_home_dir = /mysql/log
innodb_file_per_table
tmpdir=/mysql/tmpdir
innodb_undo_directory = /mysql/undo
default-storage-engine = innodb
default_tmp_storage_engine = innodb
innodb_log_files_in_group = 4
innodb_log_file_size = 1G
innodb_log_buffer_size = 8M
innodb_buffer_pool_size = 6G	
large-pages	
innodb_buffer_pool_instances = 64	
innodb_flush_method=O_DIRECT	
innodb_flush_neighbors=0	 
innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit=1
innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown=1	
innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup=1	
bulk_insert_buffer_size = 256	
innodb_thread_concurrency = 16	
 	 
# Undo tablespace	 
innodb_undo_tablespaces = 5	
 	 
# Networking	 
wait_timeout=57600	 
max_allowed_packet=1G	
socket=/var/lib/mysql/mysql.sock	 
skip-name-resolve
port=3306	
max_connections=1000	


[mysqld_safe]
log-error=/mysql/log/mysqld.log
pid-file=/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.pid" | sudo tee /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf

sudo sed -i "/\[mysqld\]/a server-id=100" /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf


# -*- Sysctl configuration
mysql_grp_id=`id -g mysql`
sudo sysctl -w vm.swappiness=0
sudo sysctl -w vm.nr_hugepages=1024
sudo sysctl -w vm.overcommit_memory=1
sudo sysctl -w vm.dirty_background_ratio=5 
sudo sysctl -w vm.dirty_ratio=15
sudo sysctl -w vm.dirty_expire_centisecs=500
sudo sysctl -w vm.dirty_writeback_centisecs=100
sudo sysctl -w vm.hugetlb_shm_group=$mysql_grp_id

echo "vm.swappiness=0
vm.nr_hugepages=1024
vm.overcommit_memory=1
vm.dirty_background_ratio=5 
vm.dirty_ratio=15
vm.dirty_expire_centisecs=500
vm.dirty_writeback_centisecs=100
vm.hugetlb_shm_group=$mysql_grp_id" | sudo tee  -a /etc/sysctl.conf

echo "ACTION=='add|change', SUBSYSTEM=='block', RUN+='/bin/sh -c \"/bin/echo 1024 > /sys%p/queue/max_sectors_kb\"'" | sudo tee /etc/udev/rules.d/71-block-max-sectors.rules
#echo 1024 | sudo tee /sys/block/sd?/queue/max_sectors_kb

echo "/dev/mysqlDataVG/mysqlDataLV /mysql/data ext4 rw,seclabel,noatime,nobarrier,stripe=4096,data=ordered 0 0" | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab
echo "/dev/mysqlLogVG/mysqlLogLV /mysql/log ext4 rw,seclabel,noatime,nobarrier,stripe=4096,data=ordered 0 0" | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab
sudo mkdir -p /mysql/log /mysql/data /mysql/tmpdir /mysql/undo
sudo mount -a
sudo chown -R mysql:mysql /mysql

sudo systemctl enable mysqld

sudo rm -rf /mysql/data/*
sudo systemctl start mysqld

#Fix to obtain temp password and set it to blank
password=$(sudo grep -oP 'temporary password(.*): \K(\S+)' /var/log/mysqld.log)
sudo mysqladmin --user=root --password="$password" password aaBB**cc1122
sudo mysql --user=root --password=aaBB**cc1122 -e "UNINSTALL COMPONENT 'file://component_validate_password'"
sudo mysqladmin --user=root --password="aaBB**cc1122" password ""


#Mysql secure installation
sudo mysql -u root<<-EOF
ALTER USER 'root'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED WITH caching_sha2_password BY '@@{gitea_password}@@';
DELETE FROM mysql.user WHERE User='root' AND Host NOT IN ('localhost', '127.0.0.1', '::1');
DELETE FROM mysql.user WHERE User='';
DELETE FROM mysql.db WHERE Db='test' OR Db='test\_%';
CREATE DATABASE gitea;
CREATE USER 'gitea'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY '@@{gitea_password}@@';
CREATE USER 'gitea'@'127.0.0.1' IDENTIFIED BY '@@{gitea_password}@@';
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON gitea.* TO 'gitea'@'localhost';
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON gitea.* TO 'gitea'@'127.0.0.1';
FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
EOF

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# Create Certificate Authority
openssl genrsa -out ca.key 4096
openssl req -x509 -new -nodes -sha512 -days 3650 \
    -subj "/C=US/ST=NC/L=Durham/O=example/OU=Personal/CN=@@{address}@@" \
    -key ca.key \
    -out ca.crt

# Create Private Key and CSR
openssl genrsa -out @@{address}@@.key 4096
openssl req -sha512 -new \
    -subj "/C=US/ST=NC/L=Durham/O=example/OU=Personal/CN=@@{address}@@" \
    -key @@{address}@@.key \
    -out @@{address}@@.csr

# Create Ext Conf file
cat > v3.ext <<-EOF
authorityKeyIdentifier=keyid,issuer
basicConstraints=CA:FALSE
keyUsage = digitalSignature, nonRepudiation, keyEncipherment, dataEncipherment
extendedKeyUsage = serverAuth 
subjectAltName = @alt_names

[alt_names]
IP.1=@@{address}@@
DNS.1=localhost
EOF

# Generate Certificate
openssl x509 -req -sha512 -days 3650 \
    -extfile v3.ext \
    -CA ca.crt -CAkey ca.key -CAcreateserial \
    -in @@{address}@@.csr \
    -out @@{address}@@.crt

# Configure Server Certificate and Key
sudo cp @@{address}@@.crt /etc/pki/tls/certs/localhost.crt
sudo cp @@{address}@@.key /etc/pki/tls/private/localhost.key

# Print out the ca to set as a variable
echo "GITEA_CA=`cat ~/ca.crt | base64 -w 0`"

#!/bin/bash

EXECUTORS=1
SSH_PORT=22
CRED_ID=Jenkins_Slave
LABELS='build docker'
USERID=admin

echo "Creating credential"

#Create credential
echo '<com.cloudbees.jenkins.plugins.sshcredentials.impl.BasicSSHUserPrivateKey plugin="ssh-credentials@1.13">
  <scope>GLOBAL</scope>
  <id>Jenkins_Slave</id>
  <description></description>
  <username>@@{CENTOS.username}@@</username>
  <privateKeySource class="com.cloudbees.jenkins.plugins.sshcredentials.impl.BasicSSHUserPrivateKey$DirectEntryPrivateKeySource">
    <privateKey>
    @@{CENTOS.secret}@@
    </privateKey>
  </privateKeySource>
</com.cloudbees.jenkins.plugins.sshcredentials.impl.BasicSSHUserPrivateKey>' | sudo java -jar jenkins-cli.jar -s "${JENKINS_URL}"  -http -auth ${USERID}:@@{Jenkins_Master.authpwd}@@ create-credentials-by-xml system::system::jenkins _

echo "Creating slave node"

#Create Slave Node
cat <<EOF | sudo java -jar jenkins-cli.jar -s "${JENKINS_URL}" -http -auth ${USERID}:@@{Jenkins_Master.authpwd}@@ create-node ${NODE_NAME}
<slave>
  <name>${NODE_NAME}</name>
  <description></description>
  <remoteFS>${NODE_SLAVE_HOME}</remoteFS>
  <numExecutors>${EXECUTORS}</numExecutors>
  <mode>NORMAL</mode>
  <retentionStrategy class="hudson.slaves.RetentionStrategy$Always"/>
  <launcher class="hudson.plugins.sshslaves.SSHLauncher" plugin="ssh-slaves@1.21">

  </launcher>
  <label>${LABELS}</label>
  <nodeProperties/>
</slave>
EOF

# Set the jwt, headers and payload
jwt = '@@{calm_jwt}@@'
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json',
           'Authorization': 'Bearer {}'.format(jwt)}
payload = {}

# Set the address and make images call to get our cookie
url = "https://localhost:9440/api/nutanix/v3/images/list"
resp = urlreq(url, verb='POST', params=json.dumps(payload), headers=headers, verify=False)

# If the images call went through successfully, extract the cookie and make acs/list
if resp.ok:

  # Set the new headers and cookies, and print cookies for next task
  headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}
  cookies = {'NTNX_IGW_SESSION': resp.cookies['NTNX_IGW_SESSION']}
  print "COOKIES={0}".format(resp.cookies['NTNX_IGW_SESSION'])
  
  # Set the new url and make the call
  url = "https://localhost:7050/acs/k8s/cluster/list"
  resp = urlreq(url, verb='POST', cookies=cookies,
                params=json.dumps(payload), headers=headers, verify=False)
  
  # If the acs/list call went through successfully, print the ip and uuid of the cluster
  if resp.ok:
    for cluster in json.loads(resp.content):
      if cluster['cluster_metadata']['name'] == "@@{karbon_cluster_name}@@":
        print "K8S_UUID={0}".format(cluster['cluster_metadata']['uuid'])
        print "K8S_IP={0}".format(cluster['cluster_metadata']['k8s_config']['master_config']['external_ip'])
        exit(0)
    # If we got to this point, we didn't find a matching cluster name
    print "ERRROR: A Karbon Kubernetes cluster name of '@@{karbon_cluster_name}@@' was not found."
    print json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
    exit(1)
    
  # If the acs/list call failed
  else:
    print "Cluster create failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
    exit(1)

# If the call failed
else:
  print "Images call failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
  exit(1)

# If we made it this far, there was an error
print "Unknown Error"
exit(1)

# Set the headers, payload, and cookies
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}
cookies = {'NTNX_IGW_SESSION': '@@{COOKIES}@@'}

# Set the address and make kubeconfig call
url = "https://localhost:7050/acs/k8s/cluster/@@{K8S_UUID}@@/kubeconfig"
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', cookies=cookies, headers=headers, verify=False)

# If the call went through successfully, print out the kubeconfig
if resp.ok:
  print "KUBECONFIG={0}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['yml_config'])
  exit(0)

# If the call failed
else:
  print "Get kubeconfig failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
  exit(1)

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

sudo yum -y update
sudo yum -y install vim jq git wget

echo "alias k=kubectl" | tee -a ~/.bash_profile
echo "export GIT_REPO_URL=https://@@{Gitea.address}@@:3000/gitadmin/hello-kubernetes" | tee -a ~/.bash_profile
echo "export JENKINS_HOOK_URL=http://@@{Jenkins_Master.address}@@:8080/gitea-webhook/post" | tee -a ~/.bash_profile

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# Install kubectl
curl -LO https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-release/release/`curl -s https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-release/release/stable.txt`/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl
chmod +x ./kubectl
sudo mv ./kubectl /usr/local/bin/kubectl

# Create kubeconfig
mkdir ~/.kube
echo '@@{Kubernetes.KUBECONFIG}@@' | base64 --decode > ~/.kube/config

# Validate kubeconfig
kubectl version
kubectl get nodes

# Install MetalLB
kubectl apply -f https://raw.githubusercontent.com/google/metallb/v0.8.3/manifests/metallb.yaml

# Install nmap
sudo yum -y install nmap

# Get subnet

network=$(/usr/sbin/ip route | awk '{print $1}' | grep 10.*)

# Get unused ips

ip_list=($(nmap -v -sn -n $network -oG - | awk '/Status: Down/{print $2}'))


# Convert IP to decimal
iptodec=($(for i in "${ip_list[@]}"; do echo ${i} |tr . '\n' | awk '{s = s*256 + $1} END{print s}'; done))

# Sort the result
sorted=($(printf '%s\n' "${iptodec[@]}"|sort))

# Get the length of the array of IPs for loop iteration

len=${#sorted[@]}

# Loop through the elments in sorted variable and check if two numbers are consecutive

for ((check=1;check<$len;check++))
do
    first=${sorted[$check]}
    second=${sorted[$check+1]}
    first_increment=$[first+1]
    if [[ $second = $first_increment ]]; then
      echo "enterd if condtion"
      MLBIP1=$(export ip=$first; for i in {1..4}; do s='.'$((ip%256))$s && ((ip>>=8)); done; echo ${s:1})
      MLBIP2=$(export ip=$second; for i in {1..4}; do s='.'$((ip%256))$s && ((ip>>=8)); done; echo ${s:1})
      break
    else
      continue
    fi
done
# Create MetalLB config map

cat << EOF > metallb-config.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  namespace: metallb-system
  name: config
data:
  config: |
    address-pools:
    - name: default
      protocol: layer2
      addresses:
      - $MLBIP1-$MLBIP2
EOF

# Apply MetalLB config map
kubectl apply -f metallb-config.yaml

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# Set up keys/fingerprints on workstation
echo "@@{CENTOS.secret}@@" > ~/.ssh/id_rsa
echo "@@{CENTOS.public_key}@@" > ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub
chmod 600 ~/.ssh/id_rsa*
ssh-keyscan @@{Gitea.address}@@ >> gitkey
ssh-keygen -lf gitkey
echo `cat gitkey` >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts

# Set up password file
echo "machine @@{Gitea.address}@@
login gitadmin
password @@{gitea_password}@@" > ~/.netrc

# Configure basic git settings
git config --global push.default simple
git config --global user.email "noreply@nutanix.com"
git config --global user.name "workstation"
git config --global http.sslVerify false

# Clone the internal repo
git clone https://@@{Gitea.address}@@:3000/gitadmin/hello-kubernetes.git
cd hello-kubernetes/

# Make first commit to ensure things are working properly
sed -i 's/world/Nutanix/g' server.js
git add server.js
git commit -m 'first commit, updated banner message'
git push -u origin master
git log -p -1

#!/bin/bash

##############
#
# LVM setup script for MySQL . 4 disks for DATA and 4 for logs
# Data disks are 50GB | Log disks are 25GB 
#
#############


#PGSQL data
sudo pvcreate /dev/sdb /dev/sdc /dev/sdd /dev/sde
sudo vgcreate mysqlDataVG /dev/sdb /dev/sdd /dev/sdc /dev/sde
sudo lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i4 -I1M -n mysqlDataLV mysqlDataVG          ## Use 1MB to avoid IO amplification 
#lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i4 -I4M -n pgDataLV pgDataVG


#PGSQL logs
sudo pvcreate /dev/sdf /dev/sdg /dev/sdh /dev/sdi
sudo vgcreate mysqlLogVG /dev/sdf /dev/sdg /dev/sdh /dev/sdi
sudo lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i2 -I1M -n mysqlLogLV mysqlLogVG            ## Use 1MB to avoid IO amplification
#lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i2 -I4M -n pgLogLV pgLogVG


#Disable LVM read ahead
sudo lvchange -r 0 /dev/mysqlDataVG/mysqlDataLV
sudo lvchange -r 0 /dev/mysqlLogVG/mysqlLogLV


#Format LVMs with ext4 and use nodiscard to make sure format time is fast on Nutanix due to SCSI unmap
sudo mkfs.ext4 -E nodiscard /dev/mysqlDataVG/mysqlDataLV
sudo mkfs.ext4 -E nodiscard /dev/mysqlLogVG/mysqlLogLV

sleep 30

#!/bin/bash


echo "!includedir /etc/my.cnf.d" | sudo tee -a /etc/my.cnf

echo "[mysqld]
binlog-format=mixed
log-bin=mysql-bin
datadir=/mysql/data
sql_mode=NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION,STRICT_TRANS_TABLES
innodb_data_home_dir = /mysql/data
innodb_log_group_home_dir = /mysql/log
innodb_file_per_table
tmpdir=/mysql/tmpdir
innodb_undo_directory = /mysql/undo
default-storage-engine = innodb
default_tmp_storage_engine = innodb
innodb_log_files_in_group = 4
innodb_log_file_size = 1G
innodb_log_buffer_size = 8M
innodb_buffer_pool_size = 6G	
large-pages	
innodb_buffer_pool_instances = 64	
innodb_flush_method=O_DIRECT	
innodb_flush_neighbors=0	 
innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit=1
innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown=1	
innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup=1	
bulk_insert_buffer_size = 256	
innodb_thread_concurrency = 16	
 	 
# Undo tablespace	 
innodb_undo_tablespaces = 5	
 	 
# Networking	 
wait_timeout=57600	 
max_allowed_packet=1G	
socket=/var/lib/mysql/mysql.sock	 
skip-name-resolve
port=3306	
max_connections=1000	


[mysqld_safe]
log-error=/mysql/log/mysqld.log
pid-file=/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.pid" | sudo tee /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf

sudo sed -i "/\[mysqld\]/a server-id=100" /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf


# -*- Sysctl configuration
mysql_grp_id=`id -g mysql`
sudo sysctl -w vm.swappiness=0
sudo sysctl -w vm.nr_hugepages=1024
sudo sysctl -w vm.overcommit_memory=1
sudo sysctl -w vm.dirty_background_ratio=5 
sudo sysctl -w vm.dirty_ratio=15
sudo sysctl -w vm.dirty_expire_centisecs=500
sudo sysctl -w vm.dirty_writeback_centisecs=100
sudo sysctl -w vm.hugetlb_shm_group=$mysql_grp_id

echo "vm.swappiness=0
vm.nr_hugepages=1024
vm.overcommit_memory=1
vm.dirty_background_ratio=5 
vm.dirty_ratio=15
vm.dirty_expire_centisecs=500
vm.dirty_writeback_centisecs=100
vm.hugetlb_shm_group=$mysql_grp_id" | sudo tee  -a /etc/sysctl.conf

echo "ACTION=='add|change', SUBSYSTEM=='block', RUN+='/bin/sh -c \"/bin/echo 1024 > /sys%p/queue/max_sectors_kb\"'" | sudo tee /etc/udev/rules.d/71-block-max-sectors.rules
#echo 1024 | sudo tee /sys/block/sd?/queue/max_sectors_kb

echo "/dev/mysqlDataVG/mysqlDataLV /mysql/data ext4 rw,seclabel,noatime,nobarrier,stripe=4096,data=ordered 0 0" | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab
echo "/dev/mysqlLogVG/mysqlLogLV /mysql/log ext4 rw,seclabel,noatime,nobarrier,stripe=4096,data=ordered 0 0" | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab
sudo mkdir -p /mysql/log /mysql/data /mysql/tmpdir /mysql/undo
sudo mount -a
sudo chown -R mysql:mysql /mysql

sudo systemctl enable mysqld

sudo rm -rf /mysql/data/*
sudo systemctl start mysqld

#Fix to obtain temp password and set it to blank
password=$(sudo grep -oP 'temporary password(.*): \K(\S+)' /var/log/mysqld.log)
sudo mysqladmin --user=root --password="$password" password aaBB**cc1122
sudo mysql --user=root --password=aaBB**cc1122 -e "UNINSTALL COMPONENT 'file://component_validate_password'"
sudo mysqladmin --user=root --password="aaBB**cc1122" password ""


#Mysql secure installation
sudo mysql -u root<<-EOF
ALTER USER 'root'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED WITH caching_sha2_password BY '@@{gitea_password}@@';
DELETE FROM mysql.user WHERE User='root' AND Host NOT IN ('localhost', '127.0.0.1', '::1');
DELETE FROM mysql.user WHERE User='';
DELETE FROM mysql.db WHERE Db='test' OR Db='test\_%';
CREATE DATABASE gitea;
CREATE USER 'gitea'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY '@@{gitea_password}@@';
CREATE USER 'gitea'@'127.0.0.1' IDENTIFIED BY '@@{gitea_password}@@';
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON gitea.* TO 'gitea'@'localhost';
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON gitea.* TO 'gitea'@'127.0.0.1';
FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
EOF

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# Create Certificate Authority
openssl genrsa -out ca.key 4096
openssl req -x509 -new -nodes -sha512 -days 3650 \
    -subj "/C=US/ST=NC/L=Durham/O=example/OU=Personal/CN=@@{address}@@" \
    -key ca.key \
    -out ca.crt

# Create Private Key and CSR
openssl genrsa -out @@{address}@@.key 4096
openssl req -sha512 -new \
    -subj "/C=US/ST=NC/L=Durham/O=example/OU=Personal/CN=@@{address}@@" \
    -key @@{address}@@.key \
    -out @@{address}@@.csr

# Create Ext Conf file
cat > v3.ext <<-EOF
authorityKeyIdentifier=keyid,issuer
basicConstraints=CA:FALSE
keyUsage = digitalSignature, nonRepudiation, keyEncipherment, dataEncipherment
extendedKeyUsage = serverAuth 
subjectAltName = @alt_names

[alt_names]
IP.1=@@{address}@@
DNS.1=localhost
EOF

# Generate Certificate
openssl x509 -req -sha512 -days 3650 \
    -extfile v3.ext \
    -CA ca.crt -CAkey ca.key -CAcreateserial \
    -in @@{address}@@.csr \
    -out @@{address}@@.crt

# Configure Server Certificate and Key
sudo cp @@{address}@@.crt /etc/pki/tls/certs/localhost.crt
sudo cp @@{address}@@.key /etc/pki/tls/private/localhost.key

# Print out the ca to set as a variable
echo "GITEA_CA=`cat ~/ca.crt | base64 -w 0`"

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# Add git user
sudo adduser --system --home /home/git git
sudo mkdir /home/git
sudo chown git:git /home/git

# Create dir structure per gitea docs
sudo mkdir -p /var/lib/gitea/{custom,data,log}
sudo chown -R git:git /var/lib/gitea/
sudo chmod -R 750 /var/lib/gitea/
sudo mkdir /etc/gitea
sudo chown root:git /etc/gitea

# Get gitea binary and make executable
wget -O gitea https://dl.gitea.io/gitea/1.10.2/gitea-1.10.2-linux-amd64
chmod +x gitea

echo '[DEFAULT]

sudo su - git -c "/usr/local/bin/gitea admin create-user --admin --username gitadmin  --password '@@{gitea_password}@@' --email noreply@nutanix.com -c /etc/gitea/app.ini"

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# Create the unit file
echo '[Unit]
Description=Gitea (Git with a cup of tea)
After=network.target
After=mysql.service

[Service]
RestartSec=2s
Type=simple
User=git
Group=git
WorkingDirectory=/var/lib/gitea/
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/gitea web -c /etc/gitea/app.ini
Restart=always
Environment=USER=git HOME=/home/git GITEA_WORK_DIR=/var/lib/gitea

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target' | sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/gitea.service

# Reload daemons and start service
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl start gitea
sudo systemctl enable gitea
sudo systemctl status gitea -l

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# Set up password file
echo "machine @@{address}@@
login gitadmin
password @@{gitea_password}@@" > ~/.netrc

# Configure basic git settings
git config --global push.default simple
git config --global user.email "noreply@nutanix.com"
git config --global user.name "gitadmin"
git config --global http.sslVerify false

# Setup repo
git clone https://github.com/MichaelHaigh/hello-kubernetes.git
cd hello-kubernetes/
git remote set-url origin https://@@{address}@@:3000/gitadmin/hello-kubernetes.git
git push -u origin master

# Add webhook
#sudo su - git -c "wget -O /home/git/gitea-repositories/gitadmin/hello-kubernetes.git/hooks/post-receive https://raw.githubusercontent.com/metajack/notify-webhook/master/notify-webhook.py"

# Set the headers, payload, and cookies
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}
cookies = {'NTNX_IGW_SESSION': '@@{NEW_COOKIES}@@'}

# Set the address and make kubeconfig call
url = "https://localhost:7050/acs/k8s/cluster/@@{K8S_UUID}@@/kubeconfig"
resp = urlreq(url, verb='GET', cookies=cookies, headers=headers, verify=False)

# If the call went through successfully, print out the kubeconfig
if resp.ok:
  print "NEW_KUBECONFIG={0}".format(json.loads(resp.content)['yml_config'])
  exit(0)

# If the call failed
else:
  print "Get kubeconfig failed", json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
  exit(1)
